availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Henry Webb (Grant County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Stokes County, North Carolina, native. Son of William Webb and Elizabeth Gray Webb. Married to Cornelia A. Stroud Webb in June 1861. Father of Albert D. Webb, Robert L. Webb, and Mary E. Webb. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Grant County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private and 2nd lieutenant from 1861 to 1864. Wounded and taken prisoner at Jonesboro, Georgia, on September 1, 1864.
